title: French intelligence: China used embassies to undermine sales of France's flagship Rafale fighter jet
Kamala Harris Sparks MAGA Meltdown With Fourth of July Post
Liangzhu, the coder 'village' at the heart of China's AI frenzy
description: Hangzhou, a suburb of China, is emerging as a new AI hub, attracting entrepreneurs and tech talent with its low rents and proximity to major tech companies. Supported by government subsidies and tax breaks, the city fosters a vibrant startup ecosystem where coders collaborate and innovate, particularly in AI.
author: Meaghan Tobin

title: Croatian right-wing singer, fans perform pro-Nazi salute at massive concert
description: A right-wing Croatian singer, Marko Perkovic, also known as Thompson, ignited controversy after performing a song featuring a pro-Nazi salute at a large concert in Zagreb. Meanwhile, in Turkiye, a 53-year-old man was seriously injured by a lion that escaped from a zoo in Manavgat. The escaped lion was later shot dead after the attack.

title: ‘We want closure’: family searches for answers over Kenyan police officer missing in Haiti
description: Benedict Kuria was ambushed by suspected gang members in March while serving in security missionThe relatives of a Kenyan police officer who went missing while working in Haiti have spoken of their anguish and anger at Kenyan authorities over a lack of definitive information about what has happened to him.Benedict Kuria and some colleagues were ambushed in March by suspected gang members. Haitian media reported that he had died, but Kenya’s police service says a search is continuing. Continue reading...
author: Carlos Mureithi in Kiambu

title: US judge clears path for eight immigrants to be deported to South Sudan
description: Justice department says the men – including nationals from Vietnam, South Korea, Mexico, Laos, Cuba and Myanmar – will be flown to South SudanEight migrants lost their last-ditch effort to halt their deportation to South Sudan by the Trump administration on Friday, clearing the way for their imminent transfer after a judge in Massachusetts denied their request.Lawyers for the justice department said the men were scheduled to be flown to South Sudan on Friday at 7pm Eastern Time after two courts considered the request on an emergency basis on 4 July, when courts were otherwise closed for the Independence Day holiday. Continue reading...
author: Guardian staff and agencies

title: Israeli strike hit four areas in notorious Tehran prison. Civilians among the dead.
description: A Post review of satellite imagery and videos revealed damage that pointed to multiple strikes, with structures nearly 2,000 feet apart in ruins.
author: Nilo Tabrizy, Imogen Piper, Cate Brown, Yeganeh Torbati, Jonathan Baran

title: A notorious drug lord hid in his bunker. Then the authorities closed in.
description: Video, images and transcripts show the Ecuadorian operation to recapture escaped drug lord José Adolfo Macías Villamar, the Los Choneros leader known as Fito.
author: Arturo Torres, Samantha Schmidt

title: At least 78 dead and dozens missing in Texas floods as more rain looms
description: The death toll looks certain to rise as search-and-rescue teams brace for further storms.

title: A girls' summer camp cut tragically short by a 'horrific' deluge
description: Terrified girls at Camp Mystic swam through the broken window of one cabin into the swirling darkness of the flood.

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Bessent: Tariffs will 'boomerang' back to April levels by Aug. 1 for countries without deals
description: President Donald Trump in April announced a 90-day pause on the tariffs he had unveiled just days prior on virtually every major trading partner.

title: Elon Musk says he has formed a new U.S. political party, the 'America Party'
description: Elon Musk, the world's richest man, suggests the new party would focus "on just 2 or 3 Senate seats and 8 to 10 House districts."

title: Netanyahu Heads to Washington as Trump Pushes for Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel is set to meet with President Trump on Monday as attention has turned from Iran to a cease-fire for Gaza.
author: Isabel Kershner

title: The Little Mountain Democracy That Sustains Tibet’s Refugee Nation
description: The exile government that was built by the Dalai Lama to preserve Tibetans’ cultural identity will be put to the test by his eventual succession.
author: Mujib Mashal, Hari Kumar and Atul Loke

title: Melania Trump Faces Criticism For Social Media Post On Texas Floods
description: Social media users expressed their disappointment and frustration with Melania's response, with some asking her to apologise.

title: Desperate Search For Missing Girls As Texas Flood Death Rise to 68
description: Rescuers in Texas raced against time to find dozens of missing people, including children, swept away by flash floods that killed at least 68, as forecasters warned of new deluges.

title: Quick action by one Texas summer camp leads to timely evacuations ahead of deadly flood - AP News

title: Stock futures fall after Trump says tariffs will go into effect on Aug. 1, not July 9: Live updates - CNBC
